newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan key 3-mth CD rate falls to 0.58 percent.
newsitem.headline: Japan key 3-mth CD rate falls to 0.58 percent.

text.p: Japan's key three-month certificates of deposit (CDs) rate fell to 0.58 percent on Friday morning, its lowest level in two months, traders said.
Traders said about 70 billion yen worth of three-month CDs had been issued so far at 0.58 percent.
The rate is the lowest since June 19, when about 80 billion yen worth of three-month CDs were issued at 0.55 percent.

A trader for a regional bank said the decline in the three-month CD rate was due to market expectations that the Bank of Japan's "tankan" corporate survey results, due out next week, may be weaker than expected.
"There is some expectation in the market that the 'tankan' results won't be so good. If that turns out to be true, (CD rates) could fall further," the trader said.
